title: ID by only one letter (Gg)
content:
After trying hard (see PortadaSF image below), I only lack these letters (aa, bb, cc and dd images). Could you please help me to ID these ones?

Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [PortadaSF.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021152548/http:/typophile.com/files/PortadaSF.jpg) | 96.28 KB |
| [aa.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021152548/http:/typophile.com/files/aa_4.jpg) | 19.28 KB |
| [bb.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021152548/http:/typophile.com/files/bb_2.jpg) | 17.79 KB |
| [cc.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021152548/http:/typophile.com/files/cc_0.jpg) | 25.27 KB |
| [dd.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021152548/http:/typophile.com/files/dd_1.jpg) | 24.59 KB |
author: Meriba

comments.content: Thanks hrant, it is. Only three Gg missing!! "bb", "cc" and "dd" ^\_^
BTW, that's Wilhelm Klingspor Gotische in the first jpeg...

Thanks to both _oldnick_ (my fault, I forgot an "l"), and _defiantone_ (you're right, cc.jpg is Blackletter 686).

Now, only two "g" missing !!! [bb.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021152548/http:/typophile.com/files/bb_2.jpg) and [dd.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021152548/http:/typophile.com/files/dd_1.jpg)

PS: It's a pity that we cannot edit the first post... ^\_^
